channel.title: Assignments on MIT OpenCourseWare
channel.description: Recent content in Assignments on MIT OpenCourseWare

item.title: Assignments
item.description: There are two types of assignments from the class. They include problem sets, and design exercises. Problem sets are assigned weekly, evaluated by the professor and the teaching assistant, and returned to the student. Design exercises comprise 40% of the student’s grade. These are open-ended exercises assigned throughout the semester. Students are expected to document their work in a journal. week # PROBLEM SETS aND SOLUTIONS DESIGN EXERCISES 2 Problem Set 1 (PDF)

item.title: class03_13.pdf
item.description: This resource talks about how To develop a two-dimensional model of the truss-beam, and end-loaded as shown.

item.title: class04_1.pdf
item.description: This resource includes information on sketching the shape of the load-deflection curve.

item.title: class04_10.pdf
item.description: This resource includes execises on sketching the shear force and bending-moment diagrams for this system.

item.title: class04_11.pdf
item.description: This resource includes exercises on deriving a given equation.

item.title: class04_12.pdf
item.description: This resource includes information on developing a compatibility condition relating these two measures of deformation.

item.title: class04_14.pdf
item.description: This resource includes exercises on finding the elements of the two columns corresponding to the displacement components.

item.title: class04_15.pdf
item.description: This resource includes exercises to draw the mohr?s circle representing this state of strain at the point.

item.title: class04_16.pdf
item.description: This resource exercises to fin the centroid and the moment of inertia of the crosssection?

item.title: class04_17.pdf
item.description: This resource includes exercise to find centroid of each section, and ratio of moments of inertia.

item.title: class04_18.pdf
item.description: This resource includes exercises to estimate the shear stress acting at the intersection of the flange and the web.

item.title: class04_19.pdf
item.description: This resource include exercises to determine the maximum normal stress due to bending, and to determine the shear stress at a point on the neutral axis.

item.title: class04_2.pdf
item.description: This resource includes exercises to show the the line of action of the reaction force acting at the pin.

item.title: class04_20.pdf
item.description: This resource includes exercises to develop a quadratic equation for the location of the neutral axis.

item.title: class04_21.pdf
item.description: This resource includes exercises to develop a quadratic equation for the location of the neutral axis of the composite beam.

item.title: class04_22.pdf
item.description: This resource includes exercises to find the reactions at the three supports for the uniformly loaded beam.

item.title: class04_23.pdf
item.description: This resource explains how to find the reactions at the wall and the stiffness matrix.

item.title: class04_24.pdf
item.description: This resource includes a gallary of six problems drawn from past years? final exams.

item.title: class04_25.pdf
item.description: This resource includes a collection of six problems drawn from past years? final exams.

item.title: class04_26.pdf
item.description: This resource includes 4 problems of the same type, drawn from past years? final exams.

item.title: class04_3.pdf
item.description: This resource includes exercises to deduce the reaction forces from two requirements of static equilibrium.

item.title: class04_4.pdf
item.description: This resource includes exercises to set up the equilibrium equations whose solution will give the reaction forces.

item.title: class04_4a.pdf
item.description: This resource includes static equilibrium analysis of opening the umbrella.

item.title: class04_5.pdf
item.description: This resource includes exercises to write out the two requirements on the member forces in order for the point to be in static equilibrium.

item.title: class04_6.pdf
item.description: This resource includes exercises to show an equivalent system of a ?couple? and single force vector acting at a point.

item.title: class04_7.pdf
item.description: This resource includes exercises to deduce, from the geometry, an expression which will allow to compute the length.

item.title: class04_8.pdf
item.description: This resource includes exercises to determine how the internal (bending) moment, and internal (shear) force vary.

item.title: class04_9.pdf
item.description: This resource includes exercises to determine the reactions at the root, at the wall given a solid cylinder fixed to the wall.

item.title: de04_1.pdf
item.description: This resource includes exercise to to design a mechanical scale for making rough measurements of the weight of passengers? checked luggage at a local airport located in West Cupcake, Nevada.

item.title: de04_2.pdf
item.description: This resource includes exercises to Develop a layout of a (statically determinant) truss structure which will support the load with a factor of safety of 2.

item.title: de04_3.pdf
item.description: This resource includes exercises on truss structure is needed to support a 1 kilometer stretch of roadway.

item.title: de04_4.pdf
item.description: This resource includes exercises to Size the outside and inside diameters of the shaft striving to keep the volume of material a minimum.

item.title: de04_5.pdf
item.description: This resource includes exercises to to do an initial sizing of the section beams and determine their number and, hence, spacing.

item.title: de04_6.pdf
item.description: This resource includes exercises to design a new experiment, one which will demonstrate the effect of an axial load on the bending stiffness of a beam constrained.
